title: UserEdit
description: This object describes the JSON repsentation of a PUT request on a user. It's mostly similar to the user schema, but with some fields not required.

active.description: If false, the user will not be able to log in.

name.description: User's full name, ordered according to the End-User's locale and preferences.

streetAddress.description: Street address. This property can be specified as an array to add multiple address lines.

region.description: State, province, prefecture, or region component. Should be specified as a code when applicable.

postalCode.description: Zip code or postal code component.

country.description: Country, specified as an ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code. (e.g.: 'CA' or 'NL')

locale.description: Preferred language, for example en-FR or nl-NL.

zoneinfo.description: Users' preferred timezone. For example, 'Europe/Amsterdam' or 'America/Toronto'.

metadata.description: Arbitrary meta-data storage. This can be used for any other values the client may want to store.

modifiedAt.description: Last time the user was modified.

privileges.description: List of privileges. This object gets ignored in PUT requests and exists so API clients can GET a full user object, make their changes and then send it in the same shape.

hasPassword.description: Does the user have a password set? This will be removed in a future version. Use the authFactors resource instead.
